intro: Hypoestes purpurea, commonly known as the "Magic Bean" or "Purple Queen," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Hypoestes purpurea thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
